snippet: Recent studies seem to show that, despite conventional wisdom, curveballs pose no greater danger to young pitching arms than other pitches.
abstract: Research into the biomechanics of pitching has evolved and recent major study shows that curveballs pose no greater physical risk than other pitches for youngsters, despite what has been conventional wisdom to not let children throw them; some studies have shown that the greatest threat to young arms is not throwing curves but making too many pitches of any kind.
lead_paragraph: Recent studies seem to show that, despite conventional wisdom, curveballs pose no greater danger to young pitching arms than other pitches.

headline.seo: Debate Grows Over How to Protect Young Pitching Arms
headline.main: Young Arms and Curveballs: A Scientific Twist
